clusters.title: Netanyahu Tells UN Israel 'Must Finish the Job' in Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu Addresses UN, Vows to Continue Gaza War

items.title: Netanyahu Tells UN Israel 'Must Finish the Job' in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu struck a defiant tone in his speech to the United Nations General Assembly, vowing to continue his country’s war in Gaza until Hamas is destroyed and slamming Western nations that recognized Palestinian statehood. “We will not commit national suicide…
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu struck a defiant tone in his speech to the United Nations General Assembly, vowing to continue his country’s war in Gaza until Hamas is destroyed and slamming Western nations that recognized Palestinian statehood. “We will not commit national suicide…

items.title: Netanyahu delivers unapologetic U.N. speech after delegates walk out
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the United Nations General Assembly in a defiant speech where he touted Israel's military actions in the Middle East since the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas. CBS News' Olivia Gazis reports.
items.content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the United Nations General Assembly in a defiant speech where he touted Israel's military actions in the Middle East since the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas. CBS News' Olivia Gazis reports.

items.title: Netanyahu attacks Palestinian recognition as dozens walk out of UN speech
items.standfirst: Officials and diplomats left the auditorium in protest as the Israeli leader took the stage, leaving large parts of the hall empty.
items.content: Officials and diplomats left the auditorium in protest as the Israeli leader took the stage, leaving large parts of the hall empty.

items.title: Netanyahu Touts Regime Change Across The Middle East In UN Speech, Thanks America
items.standfirst: Netanyahu Touts Regime Change Across The Middle East In UN Speech, Thanks America Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu during his Friday speech before the UN General Assembly spent a lot of time hailing and thanking President Trump and the US for bombing Iran's nuclear facilities last June.…
items.content: Netanyahu Touts Regime Change Across The Middle East In UN Speech, Thanks America Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu during his Friday speech before the UN General Assembly spent a lot of time hailing and thanking President Trump and the US for bombing Iran's nuclear facilities last June.…

items.title: Netanyahu's speech: Main message was 'Israel against the world'
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday (September 26) in an angry UN address to block a Palestinian state, accusing European leaders of pushing his country into "national suicide" and rewarding Hamas. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani tells us more about his speech and gives us her analysis. "The main message of that speech was Israel against the world and it was portrayed physically within that UN General Assembly with that walkout of dozens and dozens of diplomats", she said.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday (September 26) in an angry UN address to block a Palestinian state, accusing European leaders of pushing his country into "national suicide" and rewarding Hamas. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani tells us more about his speech and gives us her analysis. "The main message of that speech was Israel against the world and it was portrayed physically within that UN General Assembly with that walkout of dozens and dozens of diplomats", she said.

items.title: Netanyahu tells UN that Israel ‘must finish the job’ in Gaza after dozens of delegates walk out in protest - as it happened
items.standfirst: Israeli PM rebuked Western nations for embracing Palestinian statehood after scores of delegates left the hall in protest. This live blog is closedNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outPalestinians living in poverty were also affected, the Palestinian prime minister’s spokesperson Mohammad Abu al-Rob told Agence France-Presse (AFP), with their numbers rising by more than 150% since the start of the Gaza war, and with cash assistance not paid out in more than two months.An increase in the number of Israeli checkpoints in the West Bank, and a reduction in work permits for West Bank Palestinians seeking work inside Israel have had a drastic impact. Continue reading...
items.content: Israeli PM rebuked Western nations for embracing Palestinian statehood after scores of delegates left the hall in protest. This live blog is closedNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outPalestinians living in poverty were also affected, the Palestinian prime minister’s spokesperson Mohammad Abu al-Rob told Agence France-Presse (AFP), with their numbers rising by more than 150% since the start of the Gaza war, and with cash assistance not paid out in more than two months.An increase in the number of Israeli checkpoints in the West Bank, and a reduction in work permits for West Bank Palestinians seeking work inside Israel have had a drastic impact. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel's Netanyahu addresses U.N. as some delegates walk out
items.standfirst: As Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu began speaking at the U.N. General Assembly in New York, dozens of people walked out of the room in protest.
items.content: As Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu began speaking at the U.N. General Assembly in New York, dozens of people walked out of the room in protest.

items.title: Israeli loudspeakers broadcast Netanyahu’s speech to UN into Gaza
items.standfirst: Operation prompts outrage as Israeli PM criticises western countries for recognising Palestine as a state and pledges to continue warNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outIsraeli military loudspeaker systems have broadcast Benjamin Netanyahu’s speech to the UN into Gaza in an unprecedented operation that immediately prompted controversy and outrage.In a statement on Friday, an Israeli government spokesperson said: “As part of the public diplomacy effort, the prime minister’s office has directed civilian elements, in cooperation with the [Israel Defense Forces], to place loudspeakers on the backs of trucks on the Israeli side of the Gaza border so that Prime Minister Netanyahu’s historic UN general assembly speech will be heard in the Gaza Strip.” Continue reading...
items.content: Operation prompts outrage as Israeli PM criticises western countries for recognising Palestine as a state and pledges to continue warNetanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk outIsraeli military loudspeaker systems have broadcast Benjamin Netanyahu’s speech to the UN into Gaza in an unprecedented operation that immediately prompted controversy and outrage.In a statement on Friday, an Israeli government spokesperson said: “As part of the public diplomacy effort, the prime minister’s office has directed civilian elements, in cooperation with the [Israel Defense Forces], to place loudspeakers on the backs of trucks on the Israeli side of the Gaza border so that Prime Minister Netanyahu’s historic UN general assembly speech will be heard in the Gaza Strip.” Continue reading...

items.title: As delegates walk out, Netanyahu tells UN Israel must ‘finish job’ in Gaza
items.standfirst: The Israeli leader rails against critics and denounces Western allies for recognising Palestine in fiery UN address.
items.content: The Israeli leader rails against critics and denounces Western allies for recognising Palestine in fiery UN address.

items.title: Takeaways from Benjamin Netanyahu's speech at the UN General Assembly
items.standfirst: Facing international isolation and a walkout by UN delegates, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday (September 26) said his country "must finish the job" against Hamas in Gaza in a defiant speech at the UN General Assembly. FRANCE 24's Jessica Le Masurier tells us more from New York.
items.content: Facing international isolation and a walkout by UN delegates, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday (September 26) said his country "must finish the job" against Hamas in Gaza in a defiant speech at the UN General Assembly. FRANCE 24's Jessica Le Masurier tells us more from New York.

items.title: Replay: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu addresses UN General Assembly
items.standfirst: Facing international isolation, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took the stage on day four of the UN General Assembly on Friday (September 26). Scores of delegates have walked out of as he entered the hall to give his speech.
items.content: Facing international isolation, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took the stage on day four of the UN General Assembly on Friday (September 26). Scores of delegates have walked out of as he entered the hall to give his speech.

items.title: Delegates walk out as Netanyahu prepares to address UN General Assembly
items.standfirst: Scores of delegates have walked out of the UN General Assembly as Netanyahu entered the hall to give his speech. There were boos and cheers, while applause rang out in other quarters.
items.content: Scores of delegates have walked out of the UN General Assembly as Netanyahu entered the hall to give his speech. There were boos and cheers, while applause rang out in other quarters.

items.title: Netanyahu faces diplomatic isolation at UN General Assembly
items.standfirst: UN delegates walked out as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took to the podium at the UN General Assembly.
items.content: UN delegates walked out as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took to the podium at the UN General Assembly.

items.title: At U.N., amid jeers and cheers, Netanyahu says Israel 'must finish the job' in Gaza
items.standfirst: The Israeli prime minister's speech was defiant, despite his growing international isolation over his refusal to end the devastating war to eradicate Hamas.
items.content: The Israeli prime minister's speech was defiant, despite his growing international isolation over his refusal to end the devastating war to eradicate Hamas.(Image credit: Stefan Jeremiah)

items.title: 'Order in the hall': Dozens walk out as Netanyahu begins speech at UN
items.standfirst: Dozens of people filed out of the room in protest at the United Nations General Assembly in New York.
items.content: Dozens of people filed out of the room in protest at the United Nations General Assembly in New York.

items.title: Netanyahu says Iranians must 'make Iran great again'
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke at the United Nations Assembly in New York and said the Middle East will look "dramatically different" in the near future, highlighting the Islamic Republic of Iran. Netanyahu added that the Iranian people will regain freedom and that they will make "Iran great again."
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke at the United Nations Assembly in New York and said the Middle East will look "dramatically different" in the near future, highlighting the Islamic Republic of Iran. Netanyahu added that the Iranian people will regain freedom and that they will make "Iran great again."

items.title: Watch moment diplomats walk out as Israeli PM speaks at UN
items.standfirst: Dozens of diplomats have walked out of the UN's assembly hall as Israel's prime minister took to the podium to speak.
items.content: Dozens of diplomats have walked out of the UN's assembly hall as Israel's prime minister took to the podium to speak.

items.title: Netanyahu blasts 'shameful' recognition of Palestinian state; U.N. delegates walk out to protest speech
items.standfirst: Facing down a mass walkout and mounting diplomatic pressure, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday to “finish the job” as he defied growing isolation over his military’s devastating assault on the Gaza Strip
items.content: Facing down a mass walkout and mounting diplomatic pressure, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed Friday to “finish the job” as he defied growing isolation over his military’s devastating assault on the Gaza Strip

ai_summary: Netanyahu vowed to continue the war in Gaza until Hamas is destroyed during his UN speech.
He criticized Western nations that recognize Palestinian statehood in his UN address.
Dozens of delegates walked out of the UN General Assembly during Netanyahu's speech.
Netanyahu thanked the United States for its support in his UN speech.
The main message of the speech was Israel against the world, according to France24.

clusters.title: TikTok’s $14 billion valuation in Trump deal stuns investors
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump TikTok Deal Valuation Stuns Investors

items.title: TikTok’s $14 billion valuation in Trump deal stuns investors
items.standfirst: The $14 billion valuation that the Trump administration has estimated for TikTok’s US business falls well below projections, surprising investors who say a deal at that price would be a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC. The…
items.content: The $14 billion valuation that the Trump administration has estimated for TikTok’s US business falls well below projections, surprising investors who say a deal at that price would be a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC. The…

items.title: ByteDance to Get About 50% of TikTok US Profit Under Trump Deal
items.standfirst: TikTok’s Chinese parent company will likely get about half of the profit from the platform’s US operation even after it sells majority ownership to American investors as part of a deal orchestrated by President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.
items.content: TikTok’s Chinese parent company will likely get about half of the profit from the platform’s US operation even after it sells majority ownership to American investors as part of a deal orchestrated by President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: TikTok Gets $14 Billion Proposed Price Tag in Trump Deal
items.standfirst: The $14 billion price tag for TikTok’s US business cited by Vice President JD Vance on Thursday is well below previous projections that scaled closer to $40 billion. The estimate comes as President Donald Trump pushes forward a plan for American investors to buy the US operation from Chinese internet firm ByteDance Ltd. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television.
items.content: The $14 billion price tag for TikTok’s US business cited by Vice President JD Vance on Thursday is well below previous projections that scaled closer to $40 billion. The estimate comes as President Donald Trump pushes forward a plan for American investors to buy the US operation from Chinese internet firm ByteDance Ltd. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television.

items.title: TikTok’s $14 Billion Valuation in Trump Deal Stuns Investors
items.standfirst: The $14 billion valuation that the Trump administration has estimated for TikTok’s US business falls well below projections, surprising investors who say a deal at that price would be a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC.
items.content: The $14 billion valuation that the Trump administration has estimated for TikTok’s US business falls well below projections, surprising investors who say a deal at that price would be a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC.

items.title: Trump signs executive order to transfer TikTok to US owners
items.standfirst: Agreement separates app from Chinese owner ByteDance and allows US investors to take 80% stakeDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.Trump said he and China’s president Xi Jinping had come to an agreement to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US, separating the social media platform from its Chinese owner ByteDance. Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...
items.content: Agreement separates app from Chinese owner ByteDance and allows US investors to take 80% stakeDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.Trump said he and China’s president Xi Jinping had come to an agreement to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US, separating the social media platform from its Chinese owner ByteDance. Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump Executive Order Will Hand TikTok Over to US Investors
items.standfirst: After five deadline extensions and several rounds of negotiations, President Trump signed an executive order to put TikTok’s US operations in the hands of Oracle and other American investors.
items.content: After five deadline extensions and several rounds of negotiations, President Trump signed an executive order to put TikTok’s US operations in the hands of Oracle and other American investors.

items.title: Trump Signs TikTok Order With US App Valued at $14 Billion
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump advanced plans for American investors to buy TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese owner ByteDance Ltd., with officials setting a potential value of $14 billion and outlining measures to ensure security of the new venture.
items.content: President Donald Trump advanced plans for American investors to buy TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese owner ByteDance Ltd., with officials setting a potential value of $14 billion and outlining measures to ensure security of the new venture.

items.title: Murdoch’s TikTok? Trump offers allies another lever of media control
items.standfirst: Under the known terms of the deal with China, TikTok would get a new board, including Murdochs and EllisonsDonald Trump revealed last week the US and China are close to inking a deal to let TikTok continue operating in the US. Details are not final, but should the agreement go through as has been reported, the owners of the US’s most powerful cable TV channels may soon also steer the nation’s most influential social network. The arrangement would gift Trump’s billionaire allies a degree of control over US media that would be vast and unprecedented.Here’s what we know. Under the known terms of the deal, which Trump declared has the tentative buy-in of Chinese president Xi Jinping, TikTok in the US would get a new group of US investors, led by the US software giant Oracle, which would license TikTok’s vaunted recommendation algorithm and take over its security. Continue reading...
items.content: Under the known terms of the deal with China, TikTok would get a new board, including Murdochs and EllisonsDonald Trump revealed last week the US and China are close to inking a deal to let TikTok continue operating in the US. Details are not final, but should the agreement go through as has been reported, the owners of the US’s most powerful cable TV channels may soon also steer the nation’s most influential social network. The arrangement would gift Trump’s billionaire allies a degree of control over US media that would be vast and unprecedented.Here’s what we know. Under the known terms of the deal, which Trump declared has the tentative buy-in of Chinese president Xi Jinping, TikTok in the US would get a new group of US investors, led by the US software giant Oracle, which would license TikTok’s vaunted recommendation algorithm and take over its security. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The $14 billion valuation for TikTok's US business is below projections, surprising investors.
The deal involves American investors buying the US operation from ByteDance.
ByteDance will likely get about half of the US profit from TikTok under the deal.
Trump signed an executive order outlining the terms of the TikTok transfer.
Trump and Xi Jinping agreed to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US.

items.title: U.S. Backs Plan For Tony Blair To Head Transitional Gaza Authority
items.standfirst: The White House is backing a plan for Gaza that would see former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair head a temporary administration before transferring control to the Palestinian Authority (PA). The proposal envisions Blair heading a body called the Gaza International Transitional Authority (GITA),…
items.content: The White House is backing a plan for Gaza that would see former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair head a temporary administration before transferring control to the Palestinian Authority (PA). The proposal envisions Blair heading a body called the Gaza International Transitional Authority (GITA),…

items.title: Tony Blair in discussions to run transitional Gaza authority
items.standfirst: The former prime minister has been in high-level planning talks over the territory's future, the BBC understands.
items.content: The former prime minister has been in high-level planning talks over the territory's future, the BBC understands.

items.title: Tony Blair being lined up to lead temporary Gaza administration - reports
items.standfirst: Sir Tony Blair is being lined up to lead a temporary administration in the Gaza Strip to oversee reconstruction after the war, according to Israeli media reports.
items.content: Sir Tony Blair is being lined up to lead a temporary administration in the Gaza Strip to oversee reconstruction after the war, according to Israeli media reports.

items.title: Tony Blair seeks to play key role in Gaza under Trump peace plan
items.standfirst: US looks for former British prime minister to be involved in transitional postwar arrangement
items.content: US looks for former British prime minister to be involved in transitional postwar arrangement

items.title: Washington backing plan for Tony Blair to head transitional Gaza authority
items.standfirst: Reported proposal for international body to oversee Gaza for up to five years counters UN-backed plan for faster transition to Palestinian ruleThe White House is backing a plan that would see Tony Blair head a temporary administration of the Gaza Strip – initially without the direct involvement of the Palestinian Authority (PA), according to Israeli media reports.Under the proposal, Blair would lead a body called the Gaza International Transitional Authority (Gita) that would have a mandate to be Gaza’s “supreme political and legal authority” for as long as five years. Continue reading...
items.content: Reported proposal for international body to oversee Gaza for up to five years counters UN-backed plan for faster transition to Palestinian ruleThe White House is backing a plan that would see Tony Blair head a temporary administration of the Gaza Strip – initially without the direct involvement of the Palestinian Authority (PA), according to Israeli media reports.Under the proposal, Blair would lead a body called the Gaza International Transitional Authority (Gita) that would have a mandate to be Gaza’s “supreme political and legal authority” for as long as five years. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The White House backs a plan for Tony Blair to head a temporary Gaza administration.
Blair would lead the Gaza International Transitional Authority (GITA).
GITA would oversee Gaza for up to five years, according to reports.
The proposal contrasts with the UN-backed plan for a faster transition.
Blair has been in high-level planning talks about Gaza's future.

items.title: Trump Pharma Plan Looks Like Reprieve for Many Drugmakers

items.title: Trump says US will impose new tariffs on heavy trucks, drugs and kitchen cabinets
items.standfirst: President announces 100% tariffs on imported branded drugs, 25% on heavy-duty trucks and 50% on cabinetsDonald Trump on Thursday announced a new round of punishing tariffs, saying the United States will impose a 100% tariffs on imported branded drugs, 25% tariff on imports of all heavy-duty trucks and 50% tariffs on kitchen cabinets.The US president also said he would start charging a 50% tariff on bathroom vanities and a 30% tariff on upholstered furniture next week, with all the new duties to take effect from 1 October. Continue reading...
items.content: President announces 100% tariffs on imported branded drugs, 25% on heavy-duty trucks and 50% on cabinetsDonald Trump on Thursday announced a new round of punishing tariffs, saying the United States will impose a 100% tariffs on imported branded drugs, 25% tariff on imports of all heavy-duty trucks and 50% tariffs on kitchen cabinets.The US president also said he would start charging a 50% tariff on bathroom vanities and a 30% tariff on upholstered furniture next week, with all the new duties to take effect from 1 October. Continue reading...

Drugmakers with new US manufacturing plants would be exempt from tariffs.
Trump is imposing a 100% tariff on branded pharmaceutical imports.
The home furnishings retailer RH faced fresh tariff headlines.
Trump also announced a 25% tariff on heavy-duty trucks and 50% on cabinets.

items.title: Microsoft reduces Israel's access to cloud and AI products over reports of mass surveillance in Gaza

items.standfirst: Move follows news investigation in August revealing Israel was using Microsoft's services to spy on Palestinians.
items.content: Move follows news investigation in August revealing Israel was using Microsoft's services to spy on Palestinians.

items.title: Microsoft blocks some services used by Israeli military after probe into mass surveillance of Palestinians

items.content: Microsoft has blocked an Israeli military unit from accessing some services after preliminary evidence supported a media investigation that the software was used for surveillance of Palestinian civilian phone calls.

items.content: Microsoft has cut off services to a unit in the Israel Defense Ministry after allegations that it was using Microsoft cloud products for the mass surveillance.

ai_summary: Microsoft reduced Israel's access to cloud and AI products.

clusters.title: Ice officer ‘relieved of duties’ after video shows him manhandling woman at New York immigration court

items.title: Ice officer ‘relieved of duties’ after video shows him manhandling woman at New York immigration court
items.standfirst: Monica Moreta-Galarza was pleading with officer to release her detained husband when he pushed her to the groundA federal officer for Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) has been “relieved of his duties” after a video showing him pushing a woman to the floor at an immigration court in New York City spread quickly on social media.Tricia McLaughlin, assistant secretary for public affairs at the Department of Homeland Security sent a statement to the Guardian, saying the officer’s actions were “unacceptable and beneath the men and women of Ice”. Continue reading...
items.content: Monica Moreta-Galarza was pleading with officer to release her detained husband when he pushed her to the groundA federal officer for Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) has been “relieved of his duties” after a video showing him pushing a woman to the floor at an immigration court in New York City spread quickly on social media.Tricia McLaughlin, assistant secretary for public affairs at the Department of Homeland Security sent a statement to the Guardian, saying the officer’s actions were “unacceptable and beneath the men and women of Ice”. Continue reading...

items.title: ICE officer relieved of duties after videos show him shoving woman to ground

items.content: An ICE officer who was captured on video pushing a woman to the ground outside an immigration court in New York City has been relieved of his duties.

items.title: ICE Agent Relieved of Duty After Shoving Woman to Ground: 'Unacceptable'
items.standfirst: A clip shows a woman confronting an ICE agent who told her “adios” before pushing her to the floor in front of onlookers.
items.content: A clip shows a woman confronting an ICE agent who told her “adios” before pushing her to the floor in front of onlookers.

ai_summary: An ICE officer was relieved of duties after pushing a woman.
The incident occurred at an immigration court in New York City.
The woman was pleading for her husband's release.
A video of the incident circulated on social media.
The Department of Homeland Security called the officer's actions unacceptable.

clusters.title: Assata Shakur, an icon of Black liberation who was exiled to Cuba, dies aged 78
clusters.neutral_headline: Assata Shakur Dies in Cuba at Age 78

items.title: Assata Shakur, an icon of Black liberation who was exiled to Cuba, dies aged 78
items.standfirst: Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prisonOn 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to Cuba’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Cuban officials cited the reason for her death as old age and health conditions. Shakur, a longstanding symbol of resistance and Black liberation, spent several decades exiled in Cuba after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison.“At approximately 1:15pm on September 25th, my mother, Assata Shakur, took her last earthly breath,” her daughter Kakuya Shakur wrote on Facebook. “Words cannot describe the depth of loss that I’m feeling at this time.” Continue reading...
items.content: Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prisonOn 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to Cuba’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Cuban officials cited the reason for her death as old age and health conditions. Shakur, a longstanding symbol of resistance and Black liberation, spent several decades exiled in Cuba after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison.“At approximately 1:15pm on September 25th, my mother, Assata Shakur, took her last earthly breath,” her daughter Kakuya Shakur wrote on Facebook. “Words cannot describe the depth of loss that I’m feeling at this time.” Continue reading...

items.title: Assata Shakur dies in Cuba after decades on the run
items.standfirst: Assata Shakur, also known as Joanne Chesimard, was convicted of murdering a state trooper in 1973 and escaped prison in 1979.
items.content: Assata Shakur, also known as Joanne Chesimard, was convicted of murdering a state trooper in 1973 and escaped prison in 1979.

items.title: Assata Shakur, Black Liberation Army figure and activist, dies at 78
items.standfirst: Black liberation activist and American fugitive Assata Shakur, who escaped to Cuba more than 45 years ago after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper, died in Havana, the government announced Friday.
items.content: Black liberation activist and American fugitive Assata Shakur, who escaped to Cuba more than 45 years ago after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper, died in Havana, the government announced Friday.

ai_summary: Assata Shakur, a Black Liberation Army figure, died in Cuba at 78.
Shakur was exiled after being convicted of killing a state trooper.
She escaped from prison and lived in Cuba for decades.
Cuban officials cited old age and health conditions as the cause of death.
Shakur was a symbol of resistance and Black liberation.

items.title: Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement with FTC over 'deceptive' Prime practices: Who is eligible for a payout?
items.standfirst: (KRON/NEXSTAR) — Amazon has reached what the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is calling a “historic” $2.5 billion settlement over allegations that the company used “deceptive methods” to enroll millions of customers in Prime subscriptions. The company had also “knowingly made it difficult” for them…
items.content: (KRON/NEXSTAR) — Amazon has reached what the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is calling a “historic” $2.5 billion settlement over allegations that the company used “deceptive methods” to enroll millions of customers in Prime subscriptions. The company had also “knowingly made it difficult” for them…

items.title: Amazon Might Owe You $51. Here’s How to Find Out if You’re Eligible
items.standfirst: In a settlement with the FTC, Amazon will have to pay out over a billion dollars to US customers for “deceptive” sign-up and cancellation processes.
items.content: In a settlement with the FTC, Amazon will have to pay out over a billion dollars to US customers for “deceptive” sign-up and cancellation processes.

items.title: Amazon Will Pay $2.5 Billion to Settle FTC Suit That Alleged ‘Dark Patterns’ in Prime Sign-Ups
items.standfirst: Amazon will pay both the Federal Trade Commission and consumers directly to settle a lawsuit alleging that it used manipulative and deceptive tactics to encourage sign-ups for Prime.
items.content: Amazon will pay both the Federal Trade Commission and consumers directly to settle a lawsuit alleging that it used manipulative and deceptive tactics to encourage sign-ups for Prime.

items.title: Amazon to pay $2.5bn to settle FTC lawsuit over Prime ‘subscription traps’
items.standfirst: US regulator said company enrolled millions of customers into service without consent and made it difficult to cancelAmazon has agreed to pay $2.5bn in fines and redress to Prime subscribers to settle a lawsuit by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC), which accused the retail giant of signing users up for the service without their consent and making it difficult to cancel.In a statement, the FTC said $1.5bn of the total will go into a fund to repay eligible subscribers, on top of a $1bn civil penalty. Continue reading...
items.content: US regulator said company enrolled millions of customers into service without consent and made it difficult to cancelAmazon has agreed to pay $2.5bn in fines and redress to Prime subscribers to settle a lawsuit by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC), which accused the retail giant of signing users up for the service without their consent and making it difficult to cancel.In a statement, the FTC said $1.5bn of the total will go into a fund to repay eligible subscribers, on top of a $1bn civil penalty. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Amazon reached a $2.5 billion settlement with the FTC.
The settlement addresses deceptive Prime enrollment practices.
Amazon will pay over a billion dollars to US customers.
The FTC alleged Amazon used "dark patterns" in Prime sign-ups.
The settlement includes a $1 billion civil penalty.

clusters.title: What to know about the Canada Post strike
clusters.neutral_headline: Canada Postal Workers Strike Over Delivery Changes

items.title: What to know about the Canada Post strike
items.standfirst: The union representing thousands of Canada Post workers said its members will immediately begin a nationwide strike on Thursday, in response to Ottawa’s call to end door-to-door mail delivery. Postal workers announce immediate strike after Ottawa directs Canada Post to end door-to-door delivery
items.content: The union representing thousands of Canada Post workers said its members will immediately begin a nationwide strike on Thursday, in response to Ottawa’s call to end door-to-door mail delivery. Postal workers announce immediate strike after Ottawa directs Canada Post to end door-to-door delivery

items.title: Canada postal workers strike after government orders end to door-to-door delivery
items.standfirst: Union says it’s ‘outraged and appalled’ by government’s order of sweeping changes to the national servicePostal workers in Canada have gone on strike after the government warned of an “existential crisis” and ordered sweeping changes to the national service – including an end to door-to-door delivery within the decade.The union representing Canada Post employees described the proposed changes as “an attack” on its workers who have struggled to compete with a surge in private courier services. Continue reading...
items.content: Union says it’s ‘outraged and appalled’ by government’s order of sweeping changes to the national servicePostal workers in Canada have gone on strike after the government warned of an “existential crisis” and ordered sweeping changes to the national service – including an end to door-to-door delivery within the decade.The union representing Canada Post employees described the proposed changes as “an attack” on its workers who have struggled to compete with a surge in private courier services. Continue reading...

items.title: Nationwide strike by Canada's postal workers bring mail deliveries to a halt
items.standfirst: The strikes comes after proposals by the government that would shutter some post offices and end door-to-door delivery.
items.content: The strikes comes after proposals by the government that would shutter some post offices and end door-to-door delivery.

ai_summary: Canada Post workers began a nationwide strike.
The strike is in response to Ottawa's call to end door-to-door delivery.
The union described the changes as an attack on workers.
The government ordered sweeping changes to the national service.
The changes include ending door-to-door delivery within the decade.

items.title: Sarkozy prison sentence lays bare political divisions in France
items.standfirst: French ex-president Nicolas Sarkozy's bombshell conviction in a Libyan funding probe has elicited starkly opposing reactions from left and right, exposing France's political divide.
items.content: French ex-president Nicolas Sarkozy's bombshell conviction in a Libyan funding probe has elicited starkly opposing reactions from left and right, exposing France's political divide.

items.title: Reactions to former French President Sarkozy's jail sentence
items.standfirst: The dramatic decision to send former president Nicolas Sarkozy to prison for criminal conspiracy has laid bare France's stark political divisions, with the move cheered by the left but slammed by the ascendant right.
items.content: The dramatic decision to send former president Nicolas Sarkozy to prison for criminal conspiracy has laid bare France's stark political divisions, with the move cheered by the left but slammed by the ascendant right.

items.title: Nicolas Sarkozy’s lawyers will try to ensure time in prison is ‘as short as possible’
items.standfirst: Former French president sentenced to five years for criminal conspiracy over election campaign funds scheme with Gaddafi regimeLawyers for the former French president Nicolas Sarkozy have said they will try to ensure he serves as little time in prison as possible, after he was sentenced to five years for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to get election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.“We’re going to make sure that his incarceration will be as short as possible,” Sarkozy’s lawyer, Jean-Michel Darrois, told the BFMTV news channel on Friday after he became the first French president to go to jail. Continue reading...
items.content: Former French president sentenced to five years for criminal conspiracy over election campaign funds scheme with Gaddafi regimeLawyers for the former French president Nicolas Sarkozy have said they will try to ensure he serves as little time in prison as possible, after he was sentenced to five years for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to get election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.“We’re going to make sure that his incarceration will be as short as possible,” Sarkozy’s lawyer, Jean-Michel Darrois, told the BFMTV news channel on Friday after he became the first French president to go to jail. Continue reading...

items.title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in jail but with head held high’ after conviction
items.standfirst: Former French president receives five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy over pact with Gaddafi regimeThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy said he would “sleep in jail but with my head held high” after receiving a five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy – the first time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history.The verdict and sentencing followed a trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign. Continue reading...
items.content: Former French president receives five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy over pact with Gaddafi regimeThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy said he would “sleep in jail but with my head held high” after receiving a five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy – the first time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history.The verdict and sentencing followed a trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign. Continue reading...

items.title: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence after Libya case
items.standfirst: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.
items.content: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.

ai_summary: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy was sentenced to prison.
The sentence is for criminal conspiracy related to election funds.
Sarkozy's lawyers will try to ensure his time in prison is short.
Sarkozy said he would sleep in jail with his head held high.
The conviction has elicited opposing reactions from left and right.

clusters.title: Midtown Manhattan mass shooting gunman had low-stage CTE, medical examiner finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Midtown Manhattan Shooter Had CTE

items.title: Midtown Manhattan mass shooting gunman had low-stage CTE, medical examiner finds
items.standfirst: Shane Tamura, the gunman that killed four people in the deadly Midtown Manhattan shooting, had low-stage CTE, officials said Friday.
items.content: Shane Tamura, the gunman that killed four people in the deadly Midtown Manhattan shooting, had low-stage CTE, officials said Friday.

items.title: Man who killed four people in New York City building containing NFL headquarters had CTE
items.standfirst: Medical examiner says autopsy of Shane Tamura, who played football in high school, showed evidence of brain diseaseThe mass shooter who suspected he had CTE when he killed four people and himself in a Manhattan office building in July did in fact have the degenerative brain disease, the New York City medical examiner said on Friday.Shane Tamura, who was 27 and played football in high school, had “unambiguous diagnostic evidence” of low-stage chronic traumatic encephalopathy, the medical examiner found. The condition, which can only be diagnosed posthumously, is caused by repeated exposure to head trauma and is most commonly associated in the US with NFL players. Continue reading...
items.content: Medical examiner says autopsy of Shane Tamura, who played football in high school, showed evidence of brain diseaseThe mass shooter who suspected he had CTE when he killed four people and himself in a Manhattan office building in July did in fact have the degenerative brain disease, the New York City medical examiner said on Friday.Shane Tamura, who was 27 and played football in high school, had “unambiguous diagnostic evidence” of low-stage chronic traumatic encephalopathy, the medical examiner found. The condition, which can only be diagnosed posthumously, is caused by repeated exposure to head trauma and is most commonly associated in the US with NFL players. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Midtown Manhattan mass shooting gunman had low-stage CTE.
The medical examiner found evidence of the brain disease.
The gunman, Shane Tamura, played football in high school.
CTE is caused by repeated head trauma.
Tamura killed four people and himself in a Manhattan office building.

items.title: Digital ID plan for UK risks creating ‘an enormous hacking target’, expert warns
items.standfirst: Cyber security expert offers warning as tech companies prepare to bid for potentially multi-billion pound contractsWhy does the UK need digital IDs and what data will they include?Keir Starmer’s plan for digital IDs risks creating “an enormous hacking target”, a cybersecurity expert has warned, as technology companies prepared to bid for contracts that could run into billions of pounds.Amid widespread opposition, the prime minister said the mandatory digital ID – including citizens’ photos, names, dates of birth, nationalities and residency status – would come into use by July 2029. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Keir Starmer plans to consult on a mandatory digital ID.
The plan is criticized by rivals and civil liberties groups.
A cybersecurity expert warns of an "enormous hacking target".
The digital ID would include citizens' personal data.
The plan's implementation is scheduled for July 2029.

clusters.title: Kido nursery hackers threaten to publish more children’s profiles
clusters.neutral_headline: Nursery hackers threaten to publish more children's profiles

items.title: Kido nursery hackers threaten to publish more children’s profiles
items.standfirst: Criminals calling themselves Radiant say they will post additional private data online unless they are paidHackers with pictures and the private information of thousands of nursery children have threatened to publish more information online unless they are paid.Criminals calling themselves Radiant hacked the UK-based Kido nursery chain and posted profiles of 10 children online on Thursday. Their website on the dark web has posted a “data leakage roadmap” that sets out how the “next steps for us will be to release 30 more profiles of each child and 100 employees’ private data”. Continue reading...
items.content: Criminals calling themselves Radiant say they will post additional private data online unless they are paidHackers with pictures and the private information of thousands of nursery children have threatened to publish more information online unless they are paid.Criminals calling themselves Radiant hacked the UK-based Kido nursery chain and posted profiles of 10 children online on Thursday. Their website on the dark web has posted a “data leakage roadmap” that sets out how the “next steps for us will be to release 30 more profiles of each child and 100 employees’ private data”. Continue reading...

items.content: The criminals say they will share 30 more profiles along with 100 employees' data if a ransom is not paid.

ai_summary: Hackers, calling themselves Radiant, targeted the Kido nursery chain.
They threaten to release more private data unless a ransom is paid.
The hackers posted profiles of ten children online initially.
They plan to release 30 more profiles and 100 employees' data.
The nursery chain is based in the United Kingdom.
